story.text: I noticed that an author has accidentally deleted wiki-plugin-present item from the [[Peer Activity]] page on the hamburger menu. Markup could be NORMAL.
I had trouble finding out where this page is stored since the source didn't appear to have the page. [https://github.com/WardCunningham/wiki-plugin-present/tree/master/pages github]
Searching 83 files for "☰" (regex, case sensitive) /Users/ward/FedWiki/wiki-client/lib/legacy.coffee: 315 ) 316 317: $("  ☰ ") 318 .css({"cursor":"pointer"}) 319 .appendTo('footer') 1 match in 1 file
Git blame shows this feature went in last year. [https://github.com/fedwiki/wiki-client/commit/280680f0473bca6d84c74e70506dbef3bdf35d2c github]
I look at the constructed catalog and find the Peer Activity entry a bit unusual as it is not in the Factory menu.
Uh oh. Npm serves 1.0.0 while GitHub has 0.1.7.
